page.title: 20Holywell Area
page.content: The majority of landcover in this block is agricultural.However,the section of land nearest to Folkestone is open grassland with a series of very steep hills and deep valleys.The most well known of the valleys is known as Holywell. Holywell has many trees,a stream runs along the bottom of the valley and is very grassy. There are lots of wild flowers including the Late Spider Orchid There are many small wild animals such as rabbits,stoats,voles and mice.There are many birds and nests everywhere. The surrounding hills are made of chalk and are very difficult to climb.When you get to the top you have a marvellous view of Folkestone and the English Channel.The most well known hill is Sugar Loaf Hill. CR885
